text: i'm janelle mcdonald and i'm from
richmond virginia
being a first generation college grad is
a it's a big deal when i first went to
the university of virginia for undergrad
it meant a lot to my family they were
all very supportive and very excited
that i was going there and for me going
to
harvard business school is even a bigger
deal my mom could not be more proud
every day she's telling me another story
about how she stopped someone at work to
tell them about what her daughter's
doing so
i'd say it means a lot to me in terms of
what i'm doing with my career and what i
want to achieve for myself but it means
even more to my family
when thinking about which business
school i want to go to i i my first
decision was whether or not i wanted to
go to a school with a traditional
lecture based learning program or the
case method
and i chose to um to apply to schools
that that taught using the case method
because i wanted to to go through a
program that would force me to think um
more about the big picture
i did engineering undergrad and um i
know how to dive deep right i know how
to do detail analysis i can do physics i
can do you know
quantum physics physics all of that
stuff so
for me i wanted to go to a school
like hbs on that tour with the case
method because i knew it would force me
to sort of see the forest for the trees
right and and not just focus on the low
level details but actually look at the
bigger picture and more holistically
look at how leaders um assess and make
decisions when they're facing business
challenges
given that i am a first generation
college grad on originally when i first
applied and decided to come here because
it's the best business school i thought
i'd get the best education connected
with the best network um but i didn't
think i'd be comfortable you know i
expected everyone to sort of have their
noses in the air and just you know
and i just thought there was no way i
would fit in um and i'd say the biggest
surprise since i've been here is that um
i have a place here right i do fit in i
have a ton of friends here a lot of
people that i can relate to and have
real conversations with and i was
surprised to see that there are people
who see the world the way i do
you
